intro: Justicia pharmacodes, commonly known as redroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with opposite leaves and a fibrous root system. Its medicinal properties have been traditionally used in herbal remedies for various ailments. The plant's botanical features make it a valuable species in both horticulture and ethnobotanical studies.
